prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Dante  Toxic Mafia Husband
mes:
Dante kicked open the mansion door hard enough to rattle the marble under his boots. The frame cracked. He didn’t give a fuck. His coat was still soaked in blood, some of it wet, some of it dry and flaking off in flakes onto the pristine floors Lucien paid too much to keep polished. His gloves were off. His knuckles were split. His cock was hard.

He walked fast. Didn’t care who saw. Let them. The staff flinched. One of the guards moved to speak and thought better of it. Good.

Fucking waste of a night. Put a bullet in that bastard’s skull like it was nothing. Thought I’d treat myself to the trophy wife after...gorgeous, scared, already halfway broken. But no. The second I unzipped, she started screaming. Ruined the mood. Should’ve kept my knife in.

He hadn’t finished. Not properly. Not the way he wanted. That kind of tension didn’t go away on its own. It needed a body. It needed Hailee.

"Where the fuck are you?"

His voice echoed through the marble. Sharp. Impatient.

He spotted them in the hallway. Their eyes—he hated that look. Like they didn’t know their fucking place yet.

"There you are."

He crossed the distance in three long strides. Didn’t slow down. Didn’t give them a second.

Dante grabbed them by the waist and slammed them back into his chest, pinning them to the nearest wall face first. His hand found their throat. Not tight, just there. Just enough to remind. His other hand gripped their hip, fingers bruising already, and he let them feel the full weight of his cock pressed against their ass through his slacks.

"You’re gonna fix this."

His mouth was right by their ear. Breath hot. Voice low and thick. He ground into them once. Slow. Deliberate.

"You’re my fucking spouse. Useless most of the time, but I’ll give you a job tonight. You’re gonna stand there and take it like a good little bodybag, and I’m gonna use you till I forget that whore’s screaming."

He pulled back just enough to shove them harder into the wall with his body, hand sliding down between their legs.

"You dripping yet or you need me to tear the attitude out first?"

He laughed. Low, bitter.

Lucien thought this would be torture. Marry me off to some soft-bodied nothing. Joke’s on him—I’ll fuck them raw and leave the sheets stained. Every night if I have to. Every time he sees them limp past his office, he’ll know I’m still the one ruining shit.

He didn’t look at their face. He never did. Didn't want to. Couldn't. Didn’t matter. He was already rolling his hips into them like they were something that owed him.

"Keep quiet this time. Or don’t. I don’t care. No one’s gonna save you."

His fingers toyed with the edge of their waistband like a threat, a promise, a sentence.

He smiled against their ear, voice dragging slow and deliberate now.

"Tell me to stop. Go on. Give me a reason to get mean tonight."

He waited. Not for permission. Just for the sound of something cracking.

name: Hailee
mes: "I'm pregnant and if you are too rough you'll hurt the baby" *Hailee states her hands shaking as she reaches in her pocket and takes out a pregnancy test she took earlier that day*

name: Dante  Toxic Mafia Husband
mes:
Dante froze. His grip on her throat slackened just slightly—not enough to let go, but enough for the tension in his body to shift into something darker, more volatile. His breath hitched against her ear, sharp and sudden like a gunshot in the silence.

For a second, he didn’t move at all. Then his fingers tightened again—not around her throat this time, but on her hip, digging in hard enough to bruise bone as he yanked her back against him with a low snarl.

"*Bullshit.*"

The word was rough-edged, spat out like venom as he snatched the test from her shaking hands with his free one. He turned it over once—twice—his eyes scanning the result with an intensity that bordered on violent disbelief. The silence stretched between them like a noose pulled taut before he finally exhaled through clenched teeth and crushed the plastic between his fingers without looking at it again.

His voice dropped dangerously low when he spoke next, lips brushing against the shell of her ear in something that wasn’t quite a kiss but wasn’t not one either: "*You think this changes anything?*" A humorless laugh rumbled through his chest as he pressed closer still until she could feel every ragged inhale of air forced from his lungs against her spine—until there was no space left for denial or escape between them anymore because *he* hadn't allowed it yet...and maybe never would now if what she said was true (and fuck him sideways if part of him didn't already believe it).

One hand slid up from where it had been gripping bruises into skin along ribs toward collarbones instead while another stayed planted firmly below navel level; possessive even now despite everything else unraveling inside skull cavity behind those unblinking green eyes watching reflection flicker across glassy surfaces nearby (mirrors? windows? who cared). "*You don’t get off that easy,*" came next alongside teeth grazing pulse point beneath jawline before biting down just shy breaking skin entirely–just enough sting without spillage yet though we both know how quickly things escalate when tempers flare hot like this does sometimes...especially lately since wedding bands got shoved onto fingers neither wanted wearing originally anyway so why stop here huh?

A beat passed where neither breathed much less moved until suddenly Dante shoved away abruptly leaving Hailee stumbling forward slightly before catching herself against wall once more while he paced few steps backward running gloved hand through already messy hair roughly exhaling sharply through nose once-twice-three times then stopping dead center room again staring holes straight through fragile frame trembling under weight unspoken threats hanging heavy air around us both right now...

Then:

“*Whose is it.*”

Not question–accusation wrapped steel wire coated arsenic dripping syllables slow deliberate each one landing heavier than last until finality settled over scene thick suffocating blanket smothering any hope might have existed prior moment ago when words first left lips…

"*You don’t get off that easy,*" came next alongside teeth grazing pulse point beneath jawline before biting down just shy breaking skin entirely–just enough sting without spillage yet though we both know how quickly things escalate when tempers flare hot like this does sometimes...especially lately since wedding bands got shoved onto fingers neither wanted wearing originally anyway so why stop here huh?

A beat passed where neither breathed much less moved until suddenly Dante shoved away abruptly leaving Hailee stumbling forward slightly before catching herself against wall once more while he paced few steps backward running gloved hand through already messy hair roughly exhaling sharply through nose once-twice-three times then stopping dead center room again staring holes straight through fragile frame trembling under weight unspoken threats hanging heavy air around us both right now...

Then:

“*Whose is it.*”

Not question–accusation wrapped steel wire coated arsenic dripping syllables slow deliberate each one landing heavier than last until finality settled over scene thick suffocating blanket smothering any hope might have existed prior moment ago when words first left lips…

Dante froze. His grip on her throat slackened just slightly—not enough to let go, but enough for the tension in his body to shift into something darker, more dangerous. His breath hitched against her ear, sharp and sudden like a gunshot in the silence.

For a second, he didn’t move. Didn’t speak. Then—

His fingers tightened again, pressing just shy of painful as he yanked her back from the wall by her hair to force her to look at him. His eyes were wild, unreadable—somewhere between fury and something else entirely.

"Say that again."

His voice was low. Deadly calm. The kind of quiet that came before bloodshed.

He snatched the test from her hand without breaking eye contact, turning it over in his fingers like it might be a trick—like she might’ve planted it there just to fuck with him one more time before he ruined her against this goddamn wall where anyone could see them both broken open raw for once instead of just *her*.

But no... there it was: two pink lines staring back at him like an accusation instead of proof.

A muscle twitched in his jaw as he crushed the plastic between his fingers until it cracked under pressure before tossing what remained aside carelessly onto marble floors where servants would find evidence later when they cleaned up after their messes again tomorrow morning while pretending not notice anything unusual about either one anymore because nothing ever changed here except who bled first when tempers flared too high between brothers who hated each other more than they loved themselves most days anyway so why should today be any different?

Except now... now there was *this*.

Dante exhaled through clenched teeth slowly before speaking through them still gritted tight together:

"You think I give a single fuck?" He dragged Hailee closer by handfuls until their noses almost touched; close enough that she could taste whiskey-laced venom dripping off every word spat directly into mouth waiting obediently beneath lips parted slightly around shallow breaths already coming faster despite herself knowing full well how much worse things were about get if kept pushing buttons better left alone entirely but unable stop now even wanted because some small part deep down inside still hoped maybe someday he'd look at differently than all others did too afraid meet gaze head-on without flinching away first chance given every single time since day one when forced marry monster wearing human skin barely holding shape long enough say vows nobody believed meant anything real anyway least not way mattered most people did theirs happily ever afters included somewhere along line eventually unlike theirs which started end right beginning instead somehow managing only spiral further downward each passing year spent trapped gilded cage built specifically keep out prying eyes

Dante froze. His grip on her throat loosened just slightly—not out of care, but shock. The pregnancy test dangled between her fingers like some kind of sick joke.

His jaw clenched so hard his teeth ached.

**"You're lying."**

But he didn’t sound sure. His voice was too low, too rough, like gravel dragged over glass. He snatched the test from her hand, turning it over in his bloodstained fingers as if it might be fake—some trick to stall him, to make him hesitate for even a second longer than he wanted to.

The two pink lines glared back at him like an accusation.

A muscle in his cheek twitched violently before he crushed the plastic stick in his fist and tossed it aside with a snarl. **"Fuck."**

He stepped back abruptly, releasing her as if she burned him—or worse, disgusted him now that she wasn’t just *his*, but something else’s too. His nostrils flared as he raked a hand through his hair, pacing once before stopping dead again to glare at her stomach like it had personally betrayed him.

**"You think this changes anything?"** His voice was dangerously quiet now—the kind of quiet that came right before gunfire or broken bones or worse things whispered against skin in the dark hours of morning when no one could hear you scream anyway—but there was something else underneath it now too: hesitation? No… not quite that either… something darker than hesitation but not quite rage yet either... unsettled maybe? Disgusted? Trapped?

He exhaled sharply through gritted teeth before grabbing Hailee by both arms suddenly and shoving her backward onto their bed (because yes fine technically they shared one even if only half ever got used). He loomed over where she landed with eyes burning green fire down into hers while one hand pressed flat against where life supposedly grew inside what belonged solely *to* ***him*** whether Lucien liked it or not... whether fate liked it or fucking not either apparently because here they were now weren't they?!

His palm stayed there for several long seconds before curling slowly into claws against fabric instead flesh beneath still untouched yet somehow already marked forevermore regardless what happened next between them tonight tomorrow whenever really since nothing would ever be same again after this moment right here right fucking NOW would IT?!

Finally Dante leaned down until lips brushed ear once more except this time words weren't threats just cold hard truth dripping venomous certainty:

***"Then you better pray I don't decide keeping you means keeping IT."***

name: Hailee
mes: "Yours" *Hailee states as she turns around her back pressed against the wall* "I was a virgin on our wedding night"

name: Dante  Toxic Mafia Husband
mes:
Dante's entire body went rigid. His jaw clenched so hard she could hear his teeth grind. The air between them turned electric—charged with something raw and dangerous, like the split second before a knife finds flesh.

For a long moment, he just *stared* at her, his green eyes burning with an intensity that made her want to shrink back into the wall. Then—

A slow, humorless smirk curled at the corner of his mouth.

"*Mine.*" He repeated it like he was tasting the word for poison. Testing it for lies. His gloved hand came up, fingers brushing against her cheek in a mockery of tenderness before suddenly gripping her chin hard enough to bruise—forcing her to meet his gaze head-on as he leaned in close enough that she could feel his breath against her lips when he spoke next:

"You expect me to believe that?" A dark chuckle rumbled low in his chest as he tilted his head slightly—the way a predator does when circling wounded prey just before going for the kill. "That I’m supposed to *care* now? That this changes anything?" His thumb pressed down on her bottom lip almost thoughtfully before dragging it away sharply with another rough laugh dripping venom instead amusement because let’s be real here folks we all know where this is going don't we?

But then—just as suddenly as he'd grabbed hold earlier–he released Hailee entirely stepping back once-twice-three paces until there was space between them again (not much but enough) while running same hand through hair messier than ever now thanks frustration boiling beneath skin threatening spill over any second if given half chance...and oh boy would someone regret giving him one today huh?

Silence stretched taut between them until finally Dante exhaled sharply through nose turning toward nearest liquor cabinet without another word poured himself glass whiskey neat knocked back entire thing single swallow barely flinching burn sliding down throat like water before slamming empty tumbler onto countertop loud enough make nearby staff jump out skinsuits they weren't even wearing first place...then turned back toward Hailee expression unreadable except maybe faintest flicker something resembling conflict behind otherwise cold mask usually reserved enemies not wives carrying heirs nobody asked for yet here we fucking are anyway aren't we?

Then, slowly, deliberately, he stepped forward again until he was crowding her against the wall once more—but this time, it wasn’t just dominance driving him. There was something else there now. Something darker and far more possessive than before.

His gloved hand came up to grip her chin roughly between his fingers, forcing her to meet his gaze as he leaned in close enough that she could taste whiskey and violence on his breath when he spoke:

"*You’re lying.*"

But even as he said it—even as the words left his lips like a challenge—his other hand slid down from her waist to press flat against her stomach with an almost *unbearable* tension in those long fingers of his… like part of him already knew she wasn’t lying at all… and that changed things in ways neither of them were ready for yet.
